result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn Lee Robertson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shawn Lee Robertson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shawn Lee Robertson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
1) The court assessed only the DNA surcharge and waived all other court costs in this matter. 
2) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
3) All payments are ordered to be paid to the BURNETT COUNTY CLERK OF COURT'S OFFICE.  The defendant has sixty (60) days to make payment of any amount ordered unless other arrangements are made with the Clerk of Court's office. Make checks or money orders payable to "BURNETT COUNTY" and send to: Burnett County Clerk of Court, 7410 Cty. Rd. K,  #115, Siren, WI 54872.    
Payments may be made either in person, by mail, or online either through wicourts.gov or through paygov.us. (subject to each website's processing fees).
Partial restitution of $238.68 was stipulated to; a restitution hearing shall be held on the remaining amounts that were not stipulated to.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn Lee Robertson

records.addlTxt: Restitution Hearing on December 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:30 PM Defendant Shawn Lee Robertson in court, in custody.  Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson in court for Shawn Lee Robertson.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is on for bail/bond hearing.  State notes they are ready to resolve and are VR compliant.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Court from PLQ: def pleading to disorderly conduct without DOMAB, w/time-served; remainder to be dismissed outright, court costs and restitution, asking for a restitution hearing on just the non-stipulated amount.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  State moves to amend the DOMAB enhancer on Count 5; granted.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of amended Count 5 and orders a JOC; remaining charges are dismissed outright.  Discussion of restitution; stipulated amount is $238.68; additional amount is contested- a restitution hearing will be held on the additional amount.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def declines to make a statement to the Court.  
Court orders:  
24 days jail, 24 days jail credit
$200 DNA only; def has 60 days to pay; Court may enter a civil judgment if def fails to pay.
$238.68 restitution as stipulated; restitution hearing to be held on the contested additional amount.
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.
Restitution Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:04 PM Defendant Shawn Lee Robertson in court, in custody.  Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson in court for Shawn Lee Robertson.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Court addresses defense's bond motion- filed too late to ensure VW compliance to hear today.  Case is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Officer Bridget Getts, who is sworn in.  Atty Anderson moves to sequester witnesses; only 1 witness for State.  Off the record 1:07 PM.  Back on the record 1:07 PM, same appearances.  Off the record 1:08 PM.  Back on the record 1:09 PM, same appearances.  Witness testifies.  Atty Anderson objects- stricken.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Atty Anderson objects- speculation; sustained.  Venue is made.  Attorney Anderson crosses.  Attorney Anderson asks to strike, non-responsive; stricken.  Atty Schmidt objects- atty Anderson is testifying; sustained, stricken.  Atty Anderson moves to have the non-responsive portion to be stricken; Court denies, will allow the testimony.  Court interjects with a factual question RE: setting.  Atty Anderson's cross continues.  State redirects, plays phone call audio to refresh witness' recollection.  Atty Anderson objects; relevance; overruled.  Atty Anderson objects; sustained.  No re-cross.  Witness steps down.  State argues for bind-over.  Attorney Anderson argues against bind-over.  Court does not find probable cause for bind-over of the felony counts.  Court takes judicial notice for basis of felony cash bond.  Court finds probable cause as it relates to misdemeanors.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:30 PM Defendant Shawn Lee Robertson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bruce Anderson appears by video for defendant.  Def waives in person hearing KIV.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Atty Anderson wants to argue bond before considering time limits to prelim.  Atty Anderson argues for bond modification.  State requests to read a victim statement at victims' request.  State reads victim statement.  Atty Schmidt argues against bond modification.  Def makes statements, is advised not to.  Atty Anderson argues to reduce to $500 cash w/$5,000 sig bond.  State finishes his argument.  Court denies bond modification.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Shawn Lee Robertson

Prior: 1106 Onondaga St Ne, Fridley, MN
